amendment.description: Amendment increases the funds appropriated for vocational and adult education by $4.9 million, earmarked to the National Institute for Literacy.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 21 in the Congressional Record of July 31, 1995, to increase the funds appropriated in the bill for vocational and adult education by $4.9 million, dedicated to the National Institute for Literacy. The increase in funds would be offset by a comparable reduction in the appropriation for educational research and statistics.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Goodling amendment (A010) Agreed to by voice vote.
